text:
Idea: add the ability to clone an item in a repeater field.

Use Case: I have a series of highly versatile modules that I use in a variety of places in a site.  I'm currently in the midst of adding 89 items to a repeater field.  It would be much easier if I could set one up the right way, clone it, and then just edit the content in the cloned items.
It would also be nice if you could just add another repeater item without having to click back, then click add.
woah, 89 items - was it a situation of client thought they wanted repeater groups but then you find out HubDB was the better route for them?
I think this client has HubDB fatigue
It 100% would have been the best decision for how to deal with this, but I've got around 10 tables already (per languange)

I’ll keep re-requesting this till I die or it exists: in the HS main navbar the dropdown that comes down where it shows the account name > hover account name again
this account picker needs search badly
I have more than 100 portals I have access to. scrolling through it is painful
Can you send me a screenshot to include with an issue I’m filing
To show how bad it is when you have 100s of accounts
would be stellar if the front end sprocket menu displayed “edit template” for 404, 500, email subscribe, and password pages <https://spin.d.pr/QdHqul+>
Feature Request: ability to make fields required in HubDB to prevent clients being stupid

<@U54TVT3C1> suggested the idea that the page editor should have 2 links for “back to module” in the repeater field/group editing part of the pane. (screenshot in this post, upvote if you agree)

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Add-a-second-quot-Back-to-module-quot-link-in-the-page-editor/idi-p/253591#M29765>
